tasks.task: Perform the first pass identification of potential decision tree structures as defined in the XML tags
For each identified potential decision tree, perform the second pass verification against the strict criteria.
Analyze the context surrounding each potential decision tree to ensure accurate classification and avoid misidentifying organizational charts or static diagrams.
For verified decision trees, ensure you capture the complete logical flow including all decision nodes, process nodes, pathways, and outcomes.
Map all possible pathways from entry points to endpoints, documenting the "choose your own adventure" nature of complex decision trees.
Identify and document conditional branching logic, including what criteria determine which pathway is taken.
Capture any loop-back structures or recursive decision points where certain conditions lead back to earlier steps.
Document cross-references to external figures, tables, procedures, or other decision trees.
For probabilistic decision trees, capture probability values and likelihood-based branching where present.
Analyze decision points to identify critical factors that influence pathway selection.
Distinguish between different types of decision trees (binary, clinical protocol, conversational flow, probability-based, etc.) and capture type-specific elements.
Ensure all nodes are properly categorized as decision, process, outcome, or reference nodes based on their function in the logical flow.
Verify that identified pathways demonstrate actual decision-making logic rather than just visual connections or organizational relationships.
If no structures meet the criteria for a decision tree after the two-pass verification, respond ONLY with the not_found_response as specified.
Document the overall purpose and scope of each decision tree to provide context for the extracted logical pathways.
